snippet: A remote South Korean province’s $375 million experiment on Formula One has been a failure, but boosters say it has left a legacy: the seeds of a car-racing culture in the country.
abstract: Yeongam Journal; Formula One racetrack in South Korean province of South Jeolla lies mostly unused after failing to bring surge in foreign tourism; hosted four Korean Grand Prix races before being dropped from Formula One calendar; some see hope in country's burgeoning racing scene and say venture is not complete loss.

byline.contributor: Brad Spurgeon contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: A remote South Korean province’s $375 million experiment on Formula One has been a failure, but boosters say it has left a legacy: the seeds of a car-racing culture in the country.

headline.print_headline: A Korean Auto-Racing Debacle, but Hope Around the Bend
headline.main: A Korean Auto-Racing Debacle, but Hope Around the Bend
